The International Brotherhood of Teamste: 2. Multiple sites, including infowars.com, ran stories claiming that supplies were being withheld at the ports due to Teamsters' strike, but these stories were flagged as suspicious and based on misinterpretation of quotes.
Col: Michael Valle, who is handling relief efforts on the island for the U.S. Air Force, was quoted as saying that supplies had been sent to Puerto Rico, but the stories failed to include his statement that the condition of the roads and lack of fuel were hindering the relief effort.
Statements from Brock Long: the administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), supported the notion that the condition of the roads and lack of fuel were obstacles to the distribution of aid in Puerto Rico.
